docblock.description: this is a class for applying Aspect Oriented Programming in PHP it does this by maintaining an internal array of the lines of code and eval()'ing the modified ( ie: aspects injected ) code and instantiating an internal object.
docblock.long-description:
it then provides access to that objects methods, with advice applied at the appropriate pointcuts, via __call.

please note this class relies on the original class being well formatted code to run. it must be multi-line code and have the class endbraces on different lines than the method endbraces. the method endbraces must be on their own line.

what I mean to say is it doesn't use the tokenizer

docblock.description: this is the object place holder for what will become the new object.
docblock.long-description: the modified class ( with advice added )

docblock.description: the className you are adding advice to
the generated classname of the compiled code
the array of method names you want to inject the adivce into
an array for storing the advice methodNames.
docblock.long-description: used when we are creating overrides for aspecting

docblock.description: the new class code that gets made from the className supplied
the array that temporarily holds the lines of code
the object of this singleton class

docblock.long-description: or don't. I'm a comment not a cop.
if not called, or set, it'll just use the first method called if set to the string "all" will apply all methods of the class given
or don't. I'm a comment not a cop.

docblock.description: retruns the compiled code for debug purposes
use magic set to di the object
why am I doing this again?
use magic __call to implement the weave.
docblock.long-description: this will only work on user classes, not built in PHP classes.

docblock.description: method to instantiate the advice applied object
put the code in the classCodeArray
get the index in the code array for where to insert code before the function ( when applying before advice )
get the index in the code array for where to insert code at the end of the function ( when applying after advice )
docblock.long-description:
for conditional returns in original method, advice will be ignored.

if your return is the very last line of code in the method and is not conditional then the advice will be injected before that return statment

if the last line of code in the method is not a return statement, the advice will be injected at the end of the method

docblock.description: gets the advice code to apply
generates the method signature for method overriding
generates the method invoking call for the parent class when we're adding advice to an inherited method
apply any before advice to the method
applies the advice after the method

docblock.description: This is the cookie wrapper class.
docblock.long-description:
It allows us to obfuscate the setting of bundled cookies.

The purpose of bundled cookies is to reduce the number of cookies that the website sets, in order to not hit the browser limit of 20. It is best to keep the bundling logical, by type of cookie in particular.
It's a singleton

docblock.description: Sets the cookie $name $value with default values for path and expiry and domain.
docblock.long-description: If the cookie being set is one of our bundled cookies, it sets the new bundled value to the Cookies object, and then sets the new bundled value to the bundled cookie.

docblock.description: magic get to work with cookies
Uses the regular setcookie method if it is appropriate.
docblock.long-description: Or calls the magic set.

docblock.description: Unsets cookies even if they are in a bundle.
